name: Push-ups
description: A fundamental bodyweight exercise targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps
properForm: Start in a plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulders
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Lower your chest to the ground while keeping elbows at 45-degree angles
Push back up to starting position with controlled movement
Maintain core engagement throughout the movement
Breathe in on the way down, breathe out on the way up

commonMistakes.correction: Engage your core and maintain a straight line from head to heels
Keep elbows at 45-degree angles to protect shoulders
Lower chest all the way to the ground for maximum benefit
Keep neck neutral, don't crane your head up or down

tips: Start with wall or knee push-ups if standard is too difficult
Gradually increase repetitions as you get stronger

name: Sit-ups
description: Classic abdominal exercise that targets the entire core musculature
properForm: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor
Cross arms over chest or place hands lightly behind head
Engage core and lift your torso up towards your knees
Keep chin tucked and avoid pulling on your neck
Lower back down with control to starting position
Maintain steady breathing throughout the movement

commonMistakes.correction: Keep hands lightly behind head or crossed over chest
Move slowly and control both up and down phases
Lift shoulder blades completely off the ground
Exhale on the way up, inhale on the way down

tips: Anchor your feet under something stable if needed
Focus on using your abs, not your hip flexors
Start with smaller range of motion if full sit-ups are difficult
Progress gradually to avoid lower back strain

name: Crunches
description: Targeted abdominal exercise focusing on the upper abs
properForm: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor
Place hands lightly behind your head or crossed over chest
Engage your core and lift your shoulder blades off the ground
Focus on bringing your ribcage towards your pelvis
Hold briefly at the top, then lower slowly
Keep lower back pressed to the floor throughout

commonMistakes.correction: Use core muscles to lift, hands are just for support
Only lift shoulder blades off ground, not full torso
Move slowly and control the movement
Keep lower back pressed to the floor

tips: Think about pulling your belly button to your spine
Exhale forcefully at the top of the movement
Quality is more important than quantity
Feel the burn in your abs, not your neck

name: Running
description: Fundamental cardiovascular exercise for endurance and overall fitness
properForm: Maintain upright posture with slight forward lean
Land on the middle of your foot, not heel or toe
Keep arms relaxed with 90-degree bend at elbows
Swing arms forward and back, not across your body
Take shorter, quicker steps rather than overstriding
Breathe rhythmically through nose and mouth

commonMistakes.correction: Take shorter steps, land with feet under your center of gravity
Land on midfoot to reduce impact and improve efficiency
Keep shoulders relaxed and arms loose
Develop a breathing rhythm that matches your pace

progressions: Speed work and hills for expert
tips: Start with a pace where you can hold a conversation
Gradually increase distance by 10% each week
Focus on time rather than speed when starting
Listen to your body and rest when needed
